techmeme.title: Some Big Tech critics worry that Kamala Harris' deep ties to tech companies could prompt her to abandon Democrats' recent aggressive stance toward the sector (Washington Post)
Canva announces price raises, including hikes of 300% for some users, citing its new generative AI features, as it prepares for a US IPO (Denham Sadler/Information Age)
SAP CTO Juergen Mueller says he will leave the company by the end of September because of inappropriate conduct at a past company event (Sonja Wind/Bloomberg)
Zilch says it made an operating profit in July 2024, hitting profitability within four years of its founding date, and crossed £100M in annual revenue run rate (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
Dubai-based Ziina, a P2P payments app with 50,000 retail and business customers, raised a $22M Series A led by Altos, bringing its total funding to $30M+ (Tage Kene-Okafor/TechCrunch)
